discovery.title: BOSS Emission-Line Lensing Survey
discovery.description: Extending the spectroscopic discovery method of the SLACS Survey to the Baryon Oscillation Spectroscopic Survey (BOSS) to discover new strong gravitational galaxy-galaxy lenses at lens redshifts between 0.4 < z < 0.7, candidates are confirmed with high-resolution Hubble Space Telescope images (Brownstein et al. 2012).

discovery.title: BELLS GALaxy-Lyα EmitteR sYstems
discovery.description: The BELLS GALaxy-Lyα Emitter sYstems (BELLS GALLERY) survey applied the BELLS detection method to discover gravitational lens systems with background Lyman Alpha emission galaxies.

discovery.title: Cambridge And Sloan Survey Of Wide ARcs in the skY
discovery.description: The aim is to carry out systematic searches for wide separation (>1.5 arcsec) gravitational lens systems, looking for multiple, blue companions around massive ellipticals in the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) object catalogue. Typically, the target systems correspond to lensing of z > 0.5 star-forming galaxies by luminous red galaxies and brightest cluster galaxies. The survey started in the summer of 2007 and the first version of the catalogue was published in June 2008. http://www.ast.cam.ac.uk/ioa/research/cassowary/

discovery.title: Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with Hubble
discovery.description: Strong gravitational lenses identified in the CLASH Multi-Cycle Treasury imaging data of galaxy clusters. Moustakas (2012).

discovery.title: Cosmic Lens All-Sky Survey
discovery.description: A survey for lenses among flat-spectrum radio sources using the VLA. Approximately 16,000 objects were targeted for 30 sec each to construct the initial candidate list (Myers et al. 2003). This was then filtered using higher-resolution observations with Merlin and VLBI to identify the lenses (Browne et al. 2003).

discovery.title: CLASSextra
discovery.description: Lenses found serendipitously in follow-up observations of CLASS lenses.

discovery.title: Cosmological Evolution Survey
discovery.description: The COSMOS survey is a ~2 sq. deg. patch on the sky with extensive multi-wavelength imaging, and significant spectroscopic coverage. Home site of COSMOS is http://cosmos.astro.caltech.edu/ . There one can find guidance to access catalog data, as well as images and spectroscopy. Imaging of the field includes Chandra/XMM Xray, Galex UV, Subaru optical, Spitzer IRAC/MIPS, Sub-mm, and VLA data. Spectroscopy targeted galaxies, mostly on the bright end (i<24).

discovery.title: CFHT/Stripe-82 Megacam Survey
discovery.description: We have imaged about 170 sq-deg with CFHT/MegaCam on the i-band down to ~ 23.5 with mean seen ~ 0.65" Anupreeta More and Gabriel Caminha have carried out arc searches using different methods and we found about ~ 15 arc candidate.

discovery.title: Dark Energy Survey
discovery.description: Imaging survey in the Southern Hemisphere, beginning 2012.

discovery.title: Early-type Early-type Lenses
discovery.description: A spectroscopic survey for lenses, similar to SLACS and BELLS, but where the lensed source has a spectrum of an early-type galaxy rather than a late-type.

discovery.title: Extended Groth Strip / DEEP2 Survey
discovery.description: HST WFPC2 and ACS Survey with Keck DEIMOS spectroscopic followup. Lenses discovered through visual inspection of the full HST dataset (Moustakas et al. 2007), and re-discovered independently through a Bayesian algorithm (Marshall et al. 2009).

discovery.title: Galaxy Evolution from Morphology and SEDs
discovery.description: Systematic search for lenses in the Extended Chandra Deep Field South (ECDFS) using the GEMS ACS color imaging. The searching technique comprised of visual inspection of all color images of galaxies with stellar masses > 3x10^11 M_sol and with redshifts z<1.1 using the GEMS and COMBO-17 data. More et al. (2011)

discovery.title: Herschel Astrophysical Terahertz Large Area Survey
discovery.description: Very bright extragalactic submillimeter galaxies (SMG's) are candidates for strong lensing. http://www.h-atlas.org

discovery.title: Hamburg-ESO survey
discovery.description: Wizotski et al. 1996

discovery.title: Jodrell/VLA Astrometric Survey
discovery.description: The Jodrell/VLA Astrometric Survey (JVAS) was a radio survey completed in 1992. A precursor to CLASS, JVAS found 5 lenses that were flat-spectrum radio sources. A summary page of the discoveries is currently available here http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/research/gravlens/lensarch/lens.html

discovery.title: MAssive Cluster Survey: Lenses
discovery.description: Strong gravitational lenses identified in the The MAssive Cluster Survey (MACS) imaging data.

discovery.title: Optimal Line-of-Sight Lens Survey
discovery.description: OLS-lens survey was a follow-up campaign, of SDSS targets, with the goal of discovering new galaxy-galaxy lenses via anomalous O[II]/O[III] emission lines.

discovery.title: PanSTARRS
discovery.description: Northern hemisphere imaging survey, wedding cake observing strategy, including time domain. Lenses searched for through multiple techniques.

discovery.title: Red-Sequence Cluster Survey
discovery.description: Galaxy scale strong lenses discovered in the second Red-Sequence Cluster Survey (RCS2). http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2012arXiv1201.5583A

discovery.title: Sloan Bright Arcs Survey
discovery.description: We are carrying out the Sloan Bright Arcs Survey (SBAS), an ongoing systematic search for bright, strongly-lensed, high-redshift galaxies in samples of SDSS luminous red galaxies, clusters, and interacting/merging galaxy pairs. So far we have spectroscopically confirmed 20 lensing systems, with source galaxy redshifts z = 0.4 - 2.9, and 10 of these are among the brightest known z > 1.8 lensed galaxies. Here we will describe our search program and our sample, as well as our results on lens system modeling and source galaxy properties, derived from our optical and IR follow-up observations using ground- and space-based telescopes, including APO, Mayall, WIYN, Gemini, and HST. Kubo et al. (2009, 2010) and Diehl et al. 2009 http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2011AAS...21734701L

discovery.title: Serendipitous
discovery.description: Lenses found serendipitously through imaging or spectrocopic methods, but not part of any specific survey or discovery program.

discovery.title: Sloan Giant Arcs Survey
discovery.description: Systematic search for giant arcs in clusters and groups based on visual inspections of SDSS cluster catalogs (Hennawi et al. 2008; Bayliss et al. 2011; Oguri et al. 2012; Gladders et al. in prep.). Extensive follow-up observations at NOT, Gemini, Subaru, etc., to confirm and characterize the giant arcs and lensing clusters.

discovery.title: CFHT Strong Lenses in the Legacy Survey
discovery.description: A Homogeneous Sample of Strong Gravitational Lenses from The Canada-France-Hawaii Telescope Legacy Survey. More et al. (2012) and Gavazzi et al. (2012, in preparation)

discovery.title: Sloan Lens ACS
discovery.description: Strong gravitational lensing produces unmistakably distorted, amplified, and multiplied images of distant galaxies, and has led to the spectroscopic discovery of strong galaxy lenses by searching for evidence of emission from a background source (Bolton et al. 2004). The Sloan Lens ACS (SLACS) survey uses the background emission-line spectroscopic discovery method in combination with high-resolution, follow-up Hubble Space Telescope imaging (Bolton et al. 2006, Bolton et al. 2008, Auger et al. 2009).

discovery.title: Sloan Lens ACS Extra
discovery.description: SLACS lenses discovered and published outside of the SLACS main data release papers.

discovery.title: SOAR Gravitational Arc Survey
discovery.description: We have followed-up 47 cluster fields selected from SDSS (most in stripe 82) and found about 8 systems with good arc candidates. We are carrying out a final search for arcs and building up a dababase with information on these objects. (Furlanetto et al. 2012 [arXiv:1210.4136]).

discovery.title: South Pole Telescope
discovery.description: Selection of strong gravitational lenses based off of bright mm flux (see Vieira et al. 2010 [ApJ719(2010)763]).

discovery.title: Sloan Digital Sky Survey Quasar Lens Search
discovery.description: Survey of strongly lensed quasars among spectroscopic SDSS quasars (Oguri et al. 2006,2008,2012; Inada et al. 2008,2010,2012).

discovery.title: SDSS WFPC2 Edge-on Late-type Lens Survey
discovery.description: SWELLS is a follow-up/analysis campaign of edge-on lenses found in SDSS. The lens candidates are found in a similar manner to the SLACS lenses. A summary paper of the survey can be found here http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2011MNRAS.417.1601T

discovery.title: UKIRT Infrared Deep Sky Survey
discovery.description: UKIDSS is a large near-infrared sky survey, with the goal of taking JHK images to K~18 over ~7500 sq. deg., with deeper imaging in select fields. UKIDSS is a Norther sky survey, and has significant overlap with SDSS. http://www.ukidss.org/

discovery.title: VISTA/CFHT Stripe-82 survey
discovery.description: This is a survey in J and Ks bands with both VISTA and CFHT. VICS82 has covered about 130 sq-deg in the CS82 footprint (on SDSS stripe 82). Besides the arc searches on VICS82 data alone, the J+Ks imaging was combined with i-band from CS82 to provide color images for SpaceWarps 2 (www.spacewarps.org), which has now been completed.
